trans-unit.source: Lock Resources with Azure Resource Manager
trans-unit.target: Lock Resources with Azure Resource Manager

trans-unit.source: Lock resources to prevent users from updating or deleting certain resources.
trans-unit.target: Lock resources to prevent users from updating or deleting certain resources.

trans-unit.source: Lock resources with Azure Resource Manager
trans-unit.target: Lock resources with Azure Resource Manager

trans-unit.source: As an administrator, there are scenarios where you will want to place a lock on a resource or resource group to prevent other users in your organization from committing write actions or accidentally deleting a critical resource.
trans-unit.target: As an administrator, there are scenarios where you will want to place a lock on a resource or resource group to prevent other users in your organization from committing write actions or accidentally deleting a critical resource.

trans-unit.source: Azure Resource Manager provides the ability to restrict operations on resources through resource management locks.
trans-unit.target: Azure Resource Manager provides the ability to restrict operations on resources through resource management locks.

trans-unit.source: Resource locks are policies which enforce a lock level at a particular scope.
trans-unit.target: Resource locks are policies which enforce a lock level at a particular scope.

trans-unit.source: The lock level identifies the type of enforcement for the policy, which presently has two values – **CanNotDelete** and **ReadOnly**.
trans-unit.target: The lock level identifies the type of enforcement for the policy, which presently has two values – **CanNotDelete** and **ReadOnly**.

trans-unit.source: The scope is expressed as a URI and can be either a resource or a resource group.
trans-unit.target: The scope is expressed as a URI and can be either a resource or a resource group.

trans-unit.source: Locks are different from assigning user permissions to perform certain actions.
trans-unit.target: Locks are different from assigning user permissions to perform certain actions.

trans-unit.source: To learn about setting permissions for users and roles, see
trans-unit.target: To learn about setting permissions for users and roles, see

trans-unit.source: [Role-based access control in the preview portal](role-based-access-control-configure.md) and [Managing and Auditing Access to Resources](resource-group-rbac.md).
trans-unit.target: [Role-based access control in the preview portal](role-based-access-control-configure.md) and [Managing and Auditing Access to Resources](resource-group-rbac.md).

trans-unit.source: Common scenarios
trans-unit.target: Common scenarios

trans-unit.source: One common scenario is when you have a resource group with some resources that are used in an off-and-on pattern.
trans-unit.target: One common scenario is when you have a resource group with some resources that are used in an off-and-on pattern.

trans-unit.source: VM resources are turned on periodically to process data for a given interval of
trans-unit.target: VM resources are turned on periodically to process data for a given interval of

trans-unit.source: time and then turned off.
trans-unit.target: time and then turned off.

trans-unit.source: In this scenario, you will want to enable the shut down of the VMs but it is imperative
trans-unit.target: In this scenario, you will want to enable the shut down of the VMs but it is imperative

trans-unit.source: that a storage account not be deleted.
trans-unit.target: that a storage account not be deleted.

trans-unit.source: In this scenario, you would use a resource lock with a lock level of **CanNotDelete** on the storage account.
trans-unit.target: In this scenario, you would use a resource lock with a lock level of **CanNotDelete** on the storage account.

trans-unit.source: In another scenario, your business may have periods where you don't want updates going into production.
trans-unit.target: In another scenario, your business may have periods where you don't want updates going into production.

trans-unit.source: The **ReadOnly** lock level stops creation or updates.
trans-unit.target: The **ReadOnly** lock level stops creation or updates.

trans-unit.source: If you’re a retail company, you may not want to allow updates during holiday shopping periods.
trans-unit.target: If you’re a retail company, you may not want to allow updates during holiday shopping periods.

trans-unit.source: If you’re a financial services company, you may have constraints related to deployments during
trans-unit.target: If you’re a financial services company, you may have constraints related to deployments during

trans-unit.source: certain market hours.
trans-unit.target: certain market hours.

trans-unit.source: A resource lock can provide a policy to lock the resources as appropriate.
trans-unit.target: A resource lock can provide a policy to lock the resources as appropriate.

trans-unit.source: This could be applied to just certain resources or to the entirety of the resource group.
trans-unit.target: This could be applied to just certain resources or to the entirety of the resource group.

trans-unit.source: Creating a lock in a template
trans-unit.target: Creating a lock in a template

trans-unit.source: The example below shows a template that creates a lock on a storage account.
trans-unit.target: The example below shows a template that creates a lock on a storage account.

trans-unit.source: The storage account on which to apply the lock is provided as a parameter, and that is used
trans-unit.target: The storage account on which to apply the lock is provided as a parameter, and that is used

trans-unit.source: in conjunction with the concat() function.
trans-unit.target: in conjunction with the concat() function.

trans-unit.source: The result is the resource name appended with ‘Microsoft.Authorization’ and then a name of the lock, in this case **myLock**.
trans-unit.target: The result is the resource name appended with ‘Microsoft.Authorization’ and then a name of the lock, in this case **myLock**.

trans-unit.source: The type provided is specific to the resource type.
trans-unit.target: The type provided is specific to the resource type.

trans-unit.source: For storage, this type is "Microsoft.Storage/storageaccounts/providers/locks".
trans-unit.target: For storage, this type is "Microsoft.Storage/storageaccounts/providers/locks".

trans-unit.source: The scope level is set using the **level** property of the resource.
trans-unit.target: The scope level is set using the **level** property of the resource.

trans-unit.source: As the example is focused on helping avoid accidental deletion, the level is set as **CannotDelete**.
trans-unit.target: As the example is focused on helping avoid accidental deletion, the level is set as **CannotDelete**.

trans-unit.source: Creating a lock with REST API
trans-unit.target: Creating a lock with REST API

trans-unit.source: You can lock deployed resources with the [REST API for management locks](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/mt204563.aspx).
trans-unit.target: You can lock deployed resources with the [REST API for management locks](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/mt204563.aspx).

trans-unit.source: The REST API enables you to create and delete locks, and
trans-unit.target: The REST API enables you to create and delete locks, and

trans-unit.source: retrieve information about existing locks.
trans-unit.target: retrieve information about existing locks.

trans-unit.source: To create a lock, run:
trans-unit.target: To create a lock, run:

trans-unit.source: The scope could be a subscription, resource group or resource.
trans-unit.target: The scope could be a subscription, resource group or resource.

trans-unit.source: The lock-name is whatever you want to call the lock.
trans-unit.target: The lock-name is whatever you want to call the lock.

trans-unit.source: For api-version, use **2015-01-01**.
trans-unit.target: For api-version, use **2015-01-01**.

trans-unit.source: In the request, include a JSON object that specifies the properties for the lock.
trans-unit.target: In the request, include a JSON object that specifies the properties for the lock.

trans-unit.source: For lock-level, specify either **CanNotDelete** or **ReadOnly**.
trans-unit.target: For lock-level, specify either **CanNotDelete** or **ReadOnly**.

trans-unit.source: For examples, see [REST API for management locks](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/mt204563.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For examples, see [REST API for management locks](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/mt204563.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Creating a lock with Azure PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Creating a lock with Azure PowerShell

trans-unit.source: You can lock deployed resources with Azure PowerShell by using the **New-AzureResourceLock** as shown below.
trans-unit.target: You can lock deployed resources with Azure PowerShell by using the **New-AzureResourceLock** as shown below.

trans-unit.source: Through PowerShell, you can only set the **LockLevel** to **CanNotDelete**.
trans-unit.target: Through PowerShell, you can only set the **LockLevel** to **CanNotDelete**.

trans-unit.source: PowerShell provides other commands for working locks, such as **Set-AzureResourceLock** to update a lock and **Remove-AzureResourceLock** to delete a lock.
trans-unit.target: PowerShell provides other commands for working locks, such as **Set-AzureResourceLock** to update a lock and **Remove-AzureResourceLock** to delete a lock.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: For more information about working with resource locks, see [Lock Down Your Azure Resources](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/cloud_solution_architect/archive/2015/06/18/lock-down-your-azure-resources.aspx)
trans-unit.target: For more information about working with resource locks, see [Lock Down Your Azure Resources](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/cloud_solution_architect/archive/2015/06/18/lock-down-your-azure-resources.aspx)

trans-unit.source: To learn about logically organizing your resources, see [Using tags to organize your resources](resource-group-using-tags.md)
trans-unit.target: To learn about logically organizing your resources, see [Using tags to organize your resources](resource-group-using-tags.md)

trans-unit.source: To change which resource group a resource resides in, see [Move resources to new resource group](resource-group-move-resources.md)
trans-unit.target: To change which resource group a resource resides in, see [Move resources to new resource group](resource-group-move-resources.md)
